Quality Inn Orlando Airport
7.4 Very good
Based on 59 reviews

The airport transfer service was bad. First of all, I wrote to the hotel at the e-mail address provided by Agoda for enquiring for booking of airport transfer but the hotel did not reply.

Then I phoned the hotel when I arrived at the Orlando Airport as advised by Agoda, the receptionist of the hotel told me that the transport van would arrive in 15-20 minutes. However, it did not come after 30 minutes. Then I called the hotel again and she then replied me it was coming. However, the van arrived after another 30 minutes, i.e., I waited at the Airport for one hour after I had called the hotel. Perhaps it was due to the fact that the hotel transfer ran at hourly intervals. It might perhaps been proved by its "out-bound" air transport service as when we tried to book an 07:30 departure, the receptionist told us that the service was provided at an hourly basis. Therefore, we had no choice but take the 08:00 one. Besides, I was allocated a room at 1/F but there was no elevator. One will have a big problem if the luggage is heavy. Nevertheless, the room was clean and big. Besides, there was a air-conditioner ( cold and hot type ) inside the room.

Show more
Lawrence , Hong Kong
Allure Resort Orlando International Drive
6.9 Good
Based on 102 reviews

The property needs some refurbishment. The staff are not all as welcoming although I did not have any issues.

No complaints about the front office staff. The cleaning staff need to acknowledge the guests more. We had a large room which had a very large flat screen tv. This was nice. The under desk fridge was neatly tucked away and worked very well. A small microwave oven worked well too. The coffee machine worked. The in -room safe did not work. The sleep number beds (2 queen sized beds in the room) did not work. Whereas I like a firm bed, not everyone would appreciate that. There was a large fixed glass window which could do with a cleaning. The room carpet look tired. The bathroom was clean and functional. The in house restaurant was closed. All around spacious. I appreciate that. I would stay there again and would recommend it as a good value room. However, I would not consider staying there at the listed price of USD 200.00 per night. In fact it would be a last choice at even 100.00 i am not sure how or why the property has the title of 'Resort'. However, it was clean and reasonably functional and suited our purpose, which was to be close to where we wanted to be at a bargain price.

Show more
Bernard , Antigua & Barbuda
Orlando Metropolitan Resort
5.7 Review score
Based on 103 reviews

The Metropolitan Hotel, located on International drive is ideally placed especially for visitors to Universal and Seaworld with a shuttle service from the hotel.

I found all the staff to be friendly and the front desk staff were very helpful when my keycard would not work, they fixed it in a Jiffy Although they provide Wi-Fi access in the lobby the range was limited and perhaps consideration could be given to extending it to the rooms which would have reduced the need for regular trips to the lobby. The free continental breakfast was basic but adequate but unless you arrived soon after 7am there was soon not much left. This was provided in a downstairs room but provided no facilities to sit to eat. The rooms could best be described as tired but it suited my purposes as all I needed was somewhere to sleep whilst I was house hunting. However whilst in the lobby I had a conversation with a Brazilian lady who was on a fortnights vacation and she was online to her travel agent to get a move as she found her room dirty. It suited my purpose especially at the price but I would not recommend for 14 nights, although upon checking in I was offred an upgrade at a fee to change rooms to the newer block of the hotel. I did not see inside but assume they are of a better standard.

Show more
James , United Kingdom
Wyndham Garden Lake Buena Vista Disney Springs Resort Area
8.1 Excellent
Based on 47 reviews

This is a great place to stay if you have young children. It's been recently renovated and while there were some small annoyances (bathroom faucet aerator needed changing, and carts rolling thru halls were noisy), they were nothing compared to the fun you will have.

There are two pools. One is a large lagoon like pool with a big rock/waterfall feature and a zero entry water play ground. There two areas with steps for kids to play or adults to sit and they are spacious. The deepest water depth is approx 1 M. The other pool is an adult pool with no water features and it's deeper. There is a spa, but we didn't use it. There were plenty of chaise lounges and also some cabanas for rent. Additionally, there was a vendor with inflated pool toys for sale/rent. There is a full bar and some food service. We ate at the restaurant and it was surprisingly good. The hotel has bus service to Disney parks which is very convenient. Disney Springs (formerly Downtown Disney) is a short walk and there are plenty of restaurants and shops and even a few small rides for the kids. If you're going to be doing the parks and don't want a pool, stay somewhere else/cheaper. Our stay was for three days, Fri to Sun. We spent Fri at the Magic Kingdom and Sat/Sun at the pool. It was a great mini-vacay! The kids want to move here.

Show more
Barbara , United States
Best Western Orlando Gateway Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 123 reviews

I didn't enjoy my stay at this hotel. It wasn't horrible (I've seen worse) but it was lacking in cleanliness and things were just falling apart.

The bathroom fan was super noisy as was the shower. The air conditioner was also quite loud and didn't always work. We stayed 5 days and not one day was spent comfortably. Fortunately, we were out most of the day and really only slept and showered here. The staff was hit and miss. Some were very great and helpful while others not so much. For example, the lady at the front desk completely ignored us at check-in and helped the people that came long after us, then continued to ignore us, took her good old time and then continued to talk about how she "likes to treat people the way she would like to be treated" and that she does her job very well. It may seem like a minor thing but I was peeved since this is the first thing I had to deal with when I got to the hotel. The only saving grace was the ideal location of the hotel as it is close to everything and even offers shuttle service to Universal and Seaworld. Other perks include the free parking and wifi. Again, not horrible, but it wasn't as great as the reviews made it seem or as it tries to be. Will definitely not be staying here aagin.

Show more
Naveed , United States
Hyatt Regency Orlando
8.7 Excellent
Based on 42 reviews

Brilliant!! The staff were very professional and friendly. Room cleaned daily despite the fact that I left the room at varying times of the day.

Love that I was upgraded to a club room with lounge access. The convenience collection of toiletries etc was very useful. Plenty of storage space on rooms. No minibar but the option to have this filled with favourite snacks and drinks if you wanted. Literally my only big bear was that there were no shower gel. Shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and soap (and toothpaste) all provided free of charge, but no shower gel. Loved every minute of my stay there though and do hope to return one day

Show more
Kevin , United Kingdom
Wingate by Wyndham - Orlando International Airport Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 84 reviews

i enjoyed everything except the tolls,every time we had to go to disney parks we had to pay tolls.hotel is excellent location for people who come on bussiness.

it is conveniently located to airport with free shuttle every hour on the hour.te breakfast was very good.even the eggs were edible,which is a rarity at most buffets.the cappucino and hot chocolate were very good,they should offer cookies or fruit at the front desk as some hotels do.there are several good restaurants within walking distance which is very convenient for people flying in.the one thing i did not like was the towels annd the bath mat were very stiff.they should either use asoftener in the laundry/dryer or replace them with new ones.towels are not that expensive.

Show more
alexandra , United States
Baymont Inn and Suites Kissimmee
6 Review score
Based on 31 reviews

This hotel was pretty nice to stay at. The beds were comfortable comma and the staff were friendly. However, the bathrooms we're not very maintained.

The tub was holding water while I was taking a shower and wouldn't go down. I saw several cracks in the ceiling and in the bathroom. As for a place to stay for one night, this is okay. It is off the road some and not very well marked as where you need to turn. There's a bowling alley right beside it which makes it for an interesting evening sometimes. Overall I would stay there again if I was just going for one or two nights. If I was staying for a longer time I would not stay there.

Show more
Stacey , United States
Rosen Inn Closest to Universal
8.5 Excellent
Based on 47 reviews

I took a chance on a less known hotel after reading the reviews! I was not disappointed EXCELLENT value.

Very convenient to everything I needed and sightseeing experiences. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others. I did think breakfast was included but that could have been an oversight on my part of not reading the description more carefully. Again Great experience!

Show more
A. , United States
Wyndham Lake Buena Vista Disney Springs Resort Area
7.9 Very good
Based on 38 reviews

This was my first time to stay at this hotel and I chose it solely on price and location. It looked like a decent place to stay for our Disney vacation.

The rooms were of good size and the beds were comfortable. Nothing bad to say about the rooms. Now here's where this hotel falls short. Customer service! Now, I'm not demanding in any way whatsoever and I'm easy to please. However the service people at this hotel rubbed me the wrong way every single time. I used the coffee shop in the lobby everyday for my morning tea. During my week long stay, not one person said hello, good morning or thank you. I swear I felt like I was the one working. EVery morning I would say hello, good morning, how are you? They were basically indifferent, bored and seemed like they didn't want to be there. By the third day, I decided it was easier to just go along and frown as I orded my teas. The clerk in the gift shop was also always in a bad mood. Or tired. Or both. It almost felt uncomfortable asking her to ring me up because she was either too busy talking to her friend about her husband or co-worker, or just didn't want to be there. What's with this place. Is it such a bad place to work? I felt that they could at least try to fake a smile. Is that so hard these days? Oh well.

Show more
Shinichi , Japan
Rosen Centre Hotel
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 7 reviews

Rosen Inn International
8.6 Excellent
Based on 18 reviews

Ramada Gateway Orlando Hotel
6.8 Good
Based on 84 reviews

Pleasant stay at Ramada. The hotel is located on the westside right off of Highway 194 a few miles from Disney.

Plenty of restaurants to choose from. A few of them you can walk to but most of them you will need transportation to get to. The hotel was equipped with a large outdoor swimming pool that was kid friendly, clean, and for convenience a table with stocked towels to dry off when getting out of the pool. The room was adequate with internet, and cable t.v. Im sure most people choosing this hotel are doing so b/c of the proximity to Disney's theme parks, Universal Studio's, and/or SeaWorld. I paid around $55 and used this hotel just to sleep since most of my time was spent exploring the theme parks. If your not here enjoying Disneyworld this is not a hotel for you!

Show more
kevin , United States
Comfort Inn Orlando - Lake Buena Vista
7.9 Very good
Based on 49 reviews

Staff were really friendly and helpful allowing us to use the lobby phone free of charge to call car hiring, activity agents and cab hire services.

The rooms were very comfortable and spacious, including free wifi. The outdoor area was lovely with reclining chairs to relax by the pool, a heated spa, and a swimming pool with a water slide. Area was across the road from a store to buy groceries and also many places to eat. A free shuttle was provided for disney theme parks, however if you planning on going to other places such as universal studios, wet n wild or flea markets you will need a car for transport.

Show more
krystle , Australia
Grand Hotel Orlando
6.5 Good
Based on 53 reviews

I was very glad we only stayed the night. We as a family have Universal Studios year passes and go to Orlando by way of Tampa.

So we drive up Saturday's after work so when get good night rest and hit the parks early. The rooms are dirty, smell like the linen has been milldew and let stay in a hot room for a week. The check in staff has very attitude issues and very u accommodating. Showed up at 3:10 pm for check in and there was a line of ten different check ins, and only 1 person working. There was a man and woman they both would walk out time to time to look around, but neither offered any help. The man went to as far to walk between the line to go out side and smoke, packing his cigarettes as he walked pass. This is the worst place I have ever stayed. Half way through the night my son could not stop snizzing, and coughing from the dinginess, and smell of the room.

Show more
Roger , United States
Best Western Orlando Convention Center Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 11 reviews

Howard Johnson Inn Tropical Palms Kissimmee
5.9 Review score
Based on 44 reviews

The good. THE PRICE. It was the best price anywhere around Orlando. $191.00 for 6 nights. Although first night we had noisy people in the next room the staff took care of that immediately.

From that night on it was the quietest hotel we have ever stayed in. I had medical equipment delivered ahead that was in my room when I arrived. The bad. The room could use an update.(what a shock) The tub was rusty and looked about as old as I am. The carpet had waves that you could surf on and looked as though they have not been cleaned since the opening of the hotel. But when you take the price into consideration and a few precautions we managed well and had extra $ to spend. We got what we paid but still had a great time. Now knowing about the hotel we would return. Call us crazy.

Show more
Ronald , United States
Roomba Inn & Suites Orlando
6.1 Good
Based on 103 reviews

The room was not clean, bathroom smelled like urine and there were little black bugs near the bathroom sink and tissue holder.

Also the air fragrance dispenser was overwhelming! When we asked to change rooms we were told management does not do that and the employees did attempt to correct the room situation. However upon return to the room that night the bathroom was not cleaned at all. We did get extra towels which was nice. Also upon check in, the employee did not inform us of any of the amenities, entertainment events that may have been arranged or breakfast accommodations and times when breakfast took place. This should be made part of the check in process so guests are aware of what the hotel has to offer for an enjoyable stay.

Show more
Jeannie , United States
Rosen Inn at Pointe Orlando
7.7 Very good
Based on 18 reviews

Monumental Hotel Orlando
8.3 Excellent
Based on 44 reviews

The location is awesome and the pool is very nice. Other than that, don't waste your money. First of all they do charge an additional service fee per day and when I told them Agoda's website says that taxes and fees are included in what I have already paid they simply told me "no".

Lol. When you walk into the hotel it smells like the carpet and furniture have been there for 100 years. The hot tub smells like straight sewer water. I could get passed all of that but what upsets me the most is the bed bugs. There are a million hotels for the same price on I drive this is just not worth it. I wouldn't stay here again

Show more
Kristi , United States
Best Western Lake Buena Vista Resort Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 78 reviews

Took a while to book in as they had no record of booking. Went to guest services to collect welcome pack but actually it was so they could get you to there time share apartments by trying to sell you reduced Disney tickets.

I am surprised that the hotel allow this. We then went to the Disney shop in the hotel and purchased the Disney tickets from a very helpful lady. Reception staff were not over friendly hut the restaurant staff were excellent. Also a bit confused why I was offered an upgrade to a balcony room when booking at an additional cost when ALL rooms are with balconies. So basically ripped off.!!

Best Western Airport Inn & Suites
7.7 Very good

The hotel is close to airport and hire car depots We were late arriving at the hotel and only stayed a few hours the hotel is clean and tidy with very helpful staff.

They have a hotel ..airport shuttle with is helpful.The breakfast area gets very busy during this period as this hotel must be popular with travellers.We would stay at this hotel on our return to Orlando

Darryl , Australia
Econo Lodge Inn and Suites Maingate Central
6.3 Good
Based on 26 reviews

Quality Suites The Royale Parc Suites Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 5 reviews

Seralago Hotel and Suites Main Gate East
7.4 Very good
Based on 198 reviews

When we looked into this property, we were concerned by the poor reviews we read online. We decided, for the money, it was worth the risk.

What a shock! The hotel far surpassed our expectations. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful (additional requested towels were happily provided within 5 minutes), the room was very cute especially for families with young kids, and the amenities (heated pools, gym, game room) were very nice. The room is clean, albeit dated and could use newer cabinetry and carpeting. The a/c wasn't very strong, due in no small part to the kids "castle" that blocked the air from cooling the entire space. The ceiling fan did help mitigate this. The nearly $8 "Resort Fee" which all hotels have to one extent or another was on par, and the checking in and out of the hotel was quick and efficient. If you're looking for someplace in Orlando, close to the major theme parks, to rest your head for the night, be cute for the kids, and are on a budget then Seralago should be at the top of your list! We will return.

Show more
Howard , United States
Caribe Royale Orlando
10 Exceptional
Based on 1 reviews

B Resort and Spa located in Disney Springs Resort Area
8.1 Excellent
Based on 110 reviews

If the price for the stay was what I had booked on Agoda, it would have been great, but to arrive at the hotel and be informed there that there was the added (and hated) resort fee along with a $16 per day parking fee, was a shock.

The housekeeping staff seemed to show up way too early for our schedule, even with the Do Not Disturb sign displayed, but seemed willing to come back later. On the plus side, we were about 4 blocks from Downtown Disney, it was easy access to the interstates. The hotel was clean and the rooms were modern with top brand toiletries, a great view and large flat screen TV. The pool was wonderful. Lots of deck chairs with pool towels at the chairs. Fountains in the pool. My daughter had a wonderful time in the water. Would consider the hotel again, but would also weigh in the Resort and parking fees next time.

Show more
Brady , United States
Villas of Grand Cypress Resort
8.9 Excellent
Based on 18 reviews

Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress Resort
8.9 Excellent
Based on 28 reviews

Had a few problems.... got here and only 1 night reservation instead of two even though we had called to straighten out an issue with booking.

They were more than just sorry & the 4 of us got free buffet breakfast at Hemmingways and a late checkout. The room was pretty tiny for 4 of us. It came with a queen bed and a full. I thought that kind of strange. Although beautiful the bathroom is it has major functional issues. The glass shower only covers the 1st half of the tub & the door opens out so when you turn on the shower the floor gets wet. THE ODDEST BATHROOM DOOR I have ever seen and I have been a locksmith for 42 years now. It's a slider.....ok ......it has opaque glass on it??? And get this..... THERE IS NO LOCK ON IT and never had one. Sooooooo we had to really concentrate on not opening the door on each other and when someone was changing or showering we averted our eyes from that part or the room. Not only that but there were warning signs on the door "caution when opening" orsomething like that because if someone is looking into their luggage in the designated luggage space and someone slides the bathroom door it slams into their head. Based on 48 reviews

The Avanti Resort is located minutes from Universal and other attractions popular with visitors to Orlando.

Numerous restaurants, bars, drug stores, bodegas, and coffee shops are within walking distance of Avanti. The resort offers shuttle service to many of the attractions. You can park your car at the resort when you arrive and shuttle or walk for the rest of your stay. We had a king suite. It was roomy. The interior was a little spartan. There was a plastic table with two chairs, an l-shaped couch, and a coffee service area. The bed was outstanding. The cleaning staff did a great job. We had a minor bug issue that was resolved the first day. We asked for and received extra coffee and towels. I received an email from American Express stating a large charge had been made on my card. I contacted the front desk and spoke with a manager. She said someone at the resort had mistakenly charged another guests room and charges to my account. She cancelled the charge and generously waived the incidental fees for my stay. The swimming pool, volleyball area, shuffleboard, and workout room were more than adequate. The $7.73 Bud Light at the pool bar was my first and last bottle of beer. I walked down the street and bought a six-pack for about the same cost. They might want to take a look at the pricing structure. We normally have a Margarita at the pool late in the afternoon. I made my own! The Avanti Resort is a good middle of the road choice for a family visiting Orlando. I told the manager when I checked out I would recommend it and I would return. It's not a Disney property and I was pleased with what I got relative to the cost of the stay. Yes, I recommend the Avanti Resort.

More about Orlando (FL)

When Walt Disney turned his attention to Orlando in 1965, it was little more than a backwater town that made its living from orange cultivation. Seven years later, Disney's flagship theme park opened, redefining the modern amusement park. Today, Orlando receives upwards of 50 million visitors per year, making it one of the most-visited cities in the US.

Orlando International Airport evolved alongside this fast-growing holiday destination, and its four airside terminals are well equipped to handle the millions of passengers streaming through each year. Passengers arriving late at night can stay in the airport hotel. Otherwise, it's convenient to travel on and stay in one of the major hotels in Orlando’s city center.

The three biggest theme parks are Walt Disney World, SeaWorld, and Universal Studios. These parks are constantly vying for recognition, and visitors enjoy better attractions and greater discounts in the process.

There's no question that Orlando is a purpose-built city with children in mind, but there's still plenty to thrill parents in and out of the parks. The city itself is separate from the parks district, and it overflows with designer boutiques and fine-dining restaurants. Between the production troupes inside the parks and the chic dance clubs and lounges attached to hotels in Orlando, there's as much to do after dark as there is during the daytime.

First of all, I wrote to the hotel at the e-mail address provided by Agoda for enquiring for booking of airport transfer but the hotel did not reply. Then I phoned the hotel when I arrived at the Orlando Airport as advised by Agoda, the receptionist of the hotel told me that the transport van would arrive in 15-20 minutes. However, it did not come after 30 minutes. Then I called the hotel again and she then replied me it was coming. However, the van arrived after another 30 minutes, i.e., I waited at the Airport for one hour after I had called the hotel. Perhaps it was due to the fact that the hotel transfer ran at hourly intervals. It might perhaps been proved by its "out-bound" air transport service as when we tried to book an 07:30 departure, the receptionist told us that the service was provided at an hourly basis. Therefore, we had no choice but take the 08:00 one. Besides, I was allocated a room at 1/F but there was no elevator. One will have a big problem if the luggage is heavy. Nevertheless, the room was clean and big. Besides, there was a air-conditioner ( cold and hot type ) inside the room. Show more Lawrence , Hong Kong Allure Resort Orlando International Drive 6.9 Good Based on 102 reviews The property needs some refurbishment. The staff are not all as welcoming although I did not have any issues. No complaints about the front office staff. The cleaning staff need to acknowledge the guests more. We had a large room which had a very large flat screen tv. This was nice. The under desk fridge was neatly tucked away and worked very well. A small microwave oven worked well too. The coffee machine worked. The in -room safe did not work. The sleep number beds (2 queen sized beds in the room) did not work. Whereas I like a firm bed, not everyone would appreciate that. There was a large fixed glass window which could do with a cleaning. The room carpet look tired. The bathroom was clean and functional. The in house restaurant was closed. All around spacious. I appreciate that. I would stay there again and would recommend it as a good value room. However, I would not consider staying there at the listed price of USD 200.00 per night. In fact it would be a last choice at even 100.00 i am not sure how or why the property has the title of 'Resort'. However, it was clean and reasonably functional and suited our purpose, which was to be close to where we wanted to be at a bargain price. Show more Bernard , Antigua & Barbuda Orlando Metropolitan Resort 5.7 Review score Based on 103 reviews The Metropolitan Hotel, located on International drive is ideally placed especially for visitors to Universal and Seaworld with a shuttle service from the hotel. I found all the staff to be friendly and the front desk staff were very helpful when my keycard would not work, they fixed it in a Jiffy Although they provide Wi-Fi access in the lobby the range was limited and perhaps consideration could be given to extending it to the rooms which would have reduced the need for regular trips to the lobby. The free continental breakfast was basic but adequate but unless you arrived soon after 7am there was soon not much left. This was provided in a downstairs room but provided no facilities to sit to eat. The rooms could best be described as tired but it suited my purposes as all I needed was somewhere to sleep whilst I was house hunting. However whilst in the lobby I had a conversation with a Brazilian lady who was on a fortnights vacation and she was online to her travel agent to get a move as she found her room dirty. It suited my purpose especially at the price but I would not recommend for 14 nights, although upon checking in I was offred an upgrade at a fee to change rooms to the newer block of the hotel. I did not see inside but assume they are of a better standard. Show more James , United Kingdom Wyndham Garden Lake Buena Vista Disney Springs Resort Area 8.1 Excellent Based on 47 reviews This is a great place to stay if you have young children. It's been recently renovated and while there were some small annoyances (bathroom faucet aerator needed changing, and carts rolling thru halls were noisy), they were nothing compared to the fun you will have. There are two pools. One is a large lagoon like pool with a big rock/waterfall feature and a zero entry water play ground. There two areas with steps for kids to play or adults to sit and they are spacious. The deepest water depth is approx 1 M. The other pool is an adult pool with no water features and it's deeper. There is a spa, but we didn't use it. There were plenty of chaise lounges and also some cabanas for rent. Additionally, there was a vendor with inflated pool toys for sale/rent. There is a full bar and some food service. We ate at the restaurant and it was surprisingly good. The hotel has bus service to Disney parks which is very convenient. Disney Springs (formerly Downtown Disney) is a short walk and there are plenty of restaurants and shops and even a few small rides for the kids. If you're going to be doing the parks and don't want a pool, stay somewhere else/cheaper. Our stay was for three days, Fri to Sun. We spent Fri at the Magic Kingdom and Sat/Sun at the pool. It was a great mini-vacay! The kids want to move here. Show more Barbara , United States Best Western Orlando Gateway Hotel 7.6 Very good Based on 123 reviews I didn't enjoy my stay at this hotel. It wasn't horrible (I've seen worse) but it was lacking in cleanliness and things were just falling apart. The bathroom fan was super noisy as was the shower. The air conditioner was also quite loud and didn't always work. We stayed 5 days and not one day was spent comfortably. Fortunately, we were out most of the day and really only slept and showered here. The staff was hit and miss. Some were very great and helpful while others not so much. For example, the lady at the front desk completely ignored us at check-in and helped the people that came long after us, then continued to ignore us, took her good old time and then continued to talk about how she "likes to treat people the way she would like to be treated" and that she does her job very well. It may seem like a minor thing but I was peeved since this is the first thing I had to deal with when I got to the hotel. The only saving grace was the ideal location of the hotel as it is close to everything and even offers shuttle service to Universal and Seaworld. Other perks include the free parking and wifi. Again, not horrible, but it wasn't as great as the reviews made it seem or as it tries to be. Will definitely not be staying here aagin. Show more chiu ,Hong Kong Discover the neighborhoods of Orlando (FL) Disney - Maingate West 18096 hotels Disney Maingate - Celebration Area 3185 hotels Disney West Area 1225 hotels Kissimmee 1168 hotels International Drive South - Sea World 806 hotels Disney Downtown Lake Buena Vista 747 hotels Davenport 484 hotels Hunters Creek 215 hotels Midtown 118 hotels International Drive North - Universal 110 hotels Downtown 89 hotels Lake Bryan 70 hotels International Drive - Convention Center 66 hotels Winter Park / Altamone Springs 57 hotels Orlando International Airport 55 hotels FL Mall 33 hotels South West 27 hotels University of Central Florida 25 hotels Lake Mary 22 hotels Winter Garden 22 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Resorts in Orlando (FL) 96 More about Orlando (FL) When Walt Disney turned his attention to Orlando in 1965, it was little more than a backwater town that made its living from orange cultivation. Seven years later, Disney's flagship theme park opened, redefining the modern amusement park. Today, Orlando receives upwards of 50 million visitors per year, making it one of the most-visited cities in the US. Orlando International Airport evolved alongside this fast-growing holiday destination, and its four airside terminals are well equipped to handle the millions of passengers streaming through each year. Passengers arriving late at night can stay in the airport hotel. Otherwise, it's convenient to travel on and stay in one of the major hotels in Orlando’s city center. The three biggest theme parks are Walt Disney World , SeaWorld , and Universal Studios . These parks are constantly vying for recognition, and visitors enjoy better attractions and greater discounts in the process. There's no question that Orlando is a purpose-built city with children in mind, but there's still plenty to thrill parents in and out of the parks. The city itself is separate from the parks district, and it overflows with designer boutiques and fine-dining restaurants. Between the production troupes inside the parks and the chic dance clubs and lounges attached to hotels in Orlando, there's as much to do after dark as there is during the daytime.
